document.docAuthor: Yang, Mao-Fa, Meng, Ze-Hong & Li, Zi-Zhong
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study on the leafhopper genus Cofana Melichar (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Cicadellinae) from China, with description of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study on the leafhopper genus Cofana Melichar (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Cicadellinae) from China, with description of two new species

bibRefCitation.author: Young
bibRefCitation.refString: Young, D. A. (1979) A review of the leafhopper genus Cafana (Homoptera: Cicadellidae). Proceedings of the Entomological Society of Washington, 81 (1), 1 - 21.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 13–18.
Cofana yasumatsui
Young
.
13, pygofer, lateral view; 14, subgenital plate, ventral view; 15, aedeagus, ventral view; 16, aedeagus, lateral view; 17, connective, dorsal view; 18, style, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes. In the original description by
Young ( 1979 )
, only a lateral view of the aedeagus was provided and other aspects of the male genitalia were not illustrated. Subsequent researchers also have not provided additional illustrations of the genitalia. Here, we illustrate the male genitalia (
Figs 13–18
).
C. bidentata Krishnankutty & Viraktamath
was originally distinguished from
C. yasumatsui
based on the position of the dentate processes on the aedeagus shaft, i.e., apical in
C. yasumatsui
but anteapical in
C. bidentata (
Krishnankutty & Viraktamath, 2008
)
. Based on the description and illustrations provided by
Krishnankutty & Viraktamath ( 2008 )
the body size, coloration and other features of male genitalia of
C. bidentata
are quite similar to those of
C. yasumatsui
. In all specimens of
C. yasumatsui
we examined, the aedeagus shaft had the processes subapical in lateral view, but seemingly much closer to apex in ventral view and lateroventral view. Thus, based on comparison of the original description of
C. bidentata
Krishnankutty & Viraktamath ( 2008 )
and
C. yasumatsui Young
in
Young ( 1979 )
, and examination of male genitalia figures and many specimens collected from China , we consider
C. bidentata
Krishnankutty & Viraktamath, 2008
to be a junior synonym of
C. yasumatsui
Young, 1979
.
